content: New Zealand footballer **Tze-Xuan Loke** ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language): 子轩, [romanized](/wiki/Romanization_of_Chinese): *Zǐ Xuān*, pronounced [tsɹ̩˨˩˦ ɕyɛn˥ ˈloʊˈk]; born 26 March 2005) is a professional [footballer](/wiki/Association_football) who plays for the [Wellington Phoenix](/wiki/Wellington_Phoenix_FC). Born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), he represents [New Zealand](/wiki/New_Zealand_men%27s_national_football_team) at the youth level. ## Club career ### Youth career Born in Singapore, Loke moved to [Dunedin](/wiki/Dunedin) with his parents at a young age. Loke played for [Green Island](/wiki/Green_Island_AFC) and [Dunedin Technical](/wiki/Dunedin_Technical) at youth and senior level, before joining the Olé Football Academy in 2021. In 2022, Loke joined the Phoenix academy. ### Wellington Phoenix Loke signed his first pro-contract for the club on 20 December 2024, after captaining the reserves side. On 6 August 2024, Loke made his debut for the Wellington Phoenix in an [Australia Cup](/wiki/Australia_Cup) match against [South Melbourne](/wiki/South_Melbourne_FC). Loke made his [A-League Men](/wiki/A-League_Men) debut for the Phoenix on 18 October 2025 in a 2–2 draw away to [Perth Glory](/wiki/Perth_Glory_FC). ## International career Loke was first called up for the [New Zealand U20](/wiki/New_Zealand_men%27s_national_under-20_football_team)'s for the [2024 OFC U-19 Men's Championship](/wiki/2024_OFC_U-19_Men%27s_Championship). He made his debut in the opening group game against New Caledonia on 6 July 2024. On 12 July 2024, Loke captained the side for the first time as New Zealand beat Papua New Guinea 10–0. Loke was named as part of the 21-player New Zealand U20 squad for the [2025 FIFA U-20 World Cup](/wiki/2025_FIFA_U-20_World_Cup) that took place in [Chile](/wiki/Chile) from September to October 2025. Loke made three appearances and scored one goal in the tournament, with New Zealand exiting after the conclusion of the group stage. ## Career statistics ### Club *As of match played on 18 October 2025.*Appearances and goals by club, season and competition ClubSeasonLeagueCupOthersTotalDivisionAppsGoalsAppsGoalsAppsGoalsAppsGoals[Western Suburbs](/wiki/Western_Suburbs_FC)(/wiki/2021_New_Zealand_National_League)[National League](/wiki/New_Zealand_National_League)3000—30[Lower Hutt City](/wiki/Lower_Hutt_City_AFC)(/wiki/2022_New_Zealand_National_League)National League16220—182[Wellington Phoenix Reserves](/wiki/Wellington_Phoenix_FC_Reserves)(/wiki/2023_New_Zealand_National_League)National League130——130(/wiki/2024_New_Zealand_National_League)National League21410—224(/wiki/2025_New_Zealand_National_League)National League8100—81Total42510—435[Wellington Phoenix](/wiki/Wellington_Phoenix_FC)[2024–25](/wiki/2024%E2%80%9325_Wellington_Phoenix_FC_season)[A-League Men](/wiki/A-League_Men)0010—10[2025–26](/wiki/2025%E2%80%9326_Wellington_Phoenix_FC_season)[A-League Men](/wiki/A-League_Men)1030—40Total1040—50Career total6064000646 ## Honours **New Zealand U20** - [OFC U-19 Championship](/wiki/OFC_U-19_Championship): (/wiki/2024_OFC_U-19_Championship) - Xuan Loke at Soccerway
title: Xuan Loke
